news_header: The strike at Pron was canceled after a new collective agreement was approved, ensuring wage increases and equal family leave.
news_text: The strike threatening Pron was canceled following the approval of a new collective agreement for technology industry employees. This three-year agreement includes a total wage increase of 7.8% and ends the existing overtime ban. Trade Union Pro's Mr. Simola highlighted the importance of these wage increases in closing the purchasing power gap and emphasized the progress made in equal paid family leave. He thanked Pro members for their support and acknowledged the constructive negotiations with employers. The agreement affects around 20,000 employees and encourages local negotiations for salary adjustments based on each workplace's economic situation. Future wage increases are set at 2%, 2.2%, and 2% over the next three years, with additional employer contributions.
